channel.title: How do i change the amount of exp
channel.description: How do i change the amount of exp I receive when i attack dummys haystacks and doors and other things like that. Thanks for the Help. ;)

item.title: How do i change the amount of exp
item.dc:creator: @I_Uk_0wn4g3_I I Uk 0wn4g3 I
item.description:
@I_Uk_0wn4g3_I wrote:

addSkillXP((60playerLevel[1]), 1);
addSkillXP((15playerLevel[18]), 18);

The 1 is the skill, the 60 is the XP. same with the 15 is the XP, and 18 is the LEVEL.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i change the amount of exp

item.title: How do i change the amount of exp
item.dc:creator: @amiamage0 amiamage0
item.description:
@amiamage0 wrote:

I found what your talking about but i don’t know what to change and how much to change it by so can someone help?

I want to decrease experience gain by 90%.

I have 2 client.java’s and this one is the info from the first one---------

break;

case 299:
if(GoodDistance2(absX, absY, objectX, objectY, 3)) {
if(actionTimer == 0)
{
sendMessage(“You get defence xp!!!”);
addSkillXP((6999playerLevel[1]), 1);
addSkillXP((150playerLevel[18]), 18);
addSkillXP((500*playerLevel[17]), 17);
addItem(1050, 1);
actionTimer = 20;
setAnimation(408);
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}
}
break;

and this is from the second one-------------------------------------

break;

case 299:
if(GoodDistance2(absX, absY, objectX, objectY, 3)) {
if(actionTimer == 0)
{
sendMessage(“A magic power in the hay raises up your defence skills”);
addSkillXP((60playerLevel[1]), 1);
addSkillXP((15playerLevel[18]), 18);
actionTimer = 20;
setAnimation(0x320);
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}
}
break;

Read full topic

item.title: How do i change the amount of exp
item.dc:creator: @burg355 burg355
item.description:
@burg355 wrote:

erm well u need the object id’s

for example

say a haystack is object id - 1037

search in client.java

case 1037

and under that it shows xp given etc hope this helps
